dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 1073 RH: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to establish a structure for visitor services on the Arlington Ridge tract, in the area of the U.S. Marine Corps War Memorial, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Beyer (for himself and Mr. Cook) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources
Additional sponsor: Mr. Graves of Louisiana
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to establish a structure for visitor services on the Arlington Ridge tract, in the area of the U.S. Marine Corps War Memorial, and for other purposes.

section.text: In this Act, the term Arlington Ridge tract means the parcel of Federal land located in Arlington County, Virginia, known as the Nevius Tract and transferred to the Department of the Interior in 1953, that is bounded generally by—

paragraph.text: Arlington Boulevard (United States Route 50) to the north;
Jefferson Davis Highway (Virginia Route 110) to the east;
Marshall Drive to the south; and
North Meade Street to the west.

section.header: Establishment of a visitor services facility on the Arlington Ridge tract
section.text: Notwithstanding section 2863(g) of Public Law 107–107, the Secretary of the Interior is authorized to construct a structure for visitor services to include a public restroom facility on the Arlington Ridge tract in the area of the U.S. Marine Corps War Memorial.

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
